description: The transition shorthand CSS property sets how changes to an element's styles may occur over time. Transitions can be applied to specific CSS properties, all properties, or none.
description_html: The transition shorthand CSS property sets how changes to an element's styles may occur over time. Transitions can be applied to specific CSS properties, all properties, or none.
name: Transitions (CSS)

chrome.notes: The ontransitioncancel event handler property is not supported. To listen to this event, use element.addEventListener('transitioncancel', function() {});.

chrome_android.notes: The ontransitioncancel event handler property is not supported. To listen to this event, use element.addEventListener('transitioncancel', function() {});.

edge.notes: The ontransitioncancel event handler property is not supported. To listen to this event, use element.addEventListener('transitioncancel', function() {});.

oculus.notes: The ontransitioncancel event handler property is not supported. To listen to this event, use element.addEventListener('transitioncancel', function() {});.

opera.notes: The ontransitioncancel event handler property is not supported. To listen to this event, use element.addEventListener('transitioncancel', function() {});.

opera_android.notes: The ontransitioncancel event handler property is not supported. To listen to this event, use element.addEventListener('transitioncancel', function() {});.

safari.notes: Although the ontransitioncancel event handler property is supported, the transitioncancel event is never fired.

safari_ios.notes: Although the ontransitioncancel event handler property is supported, the transitioncancel event is never fired.

samsunginternet_android.notes: The ontransitioncancel event handler property is not supported. To listen to this event, use element.addEventListener('transitioncancel', function() {});.

webview_android.notes: The ontransitioncancel event handler property is not supported. To listen to this event, use element.addEventListener('transitioncancel', function() {});.

webview_ios.notes: Although the ontransitioncancel event handler property is supported, the transitioncancel event is never fired.

edge.notes: The ontransitionend event handler property is not supported. To listen to this event, use element.addEventListener('transitionend', function() {});.

ie.notes: The ontransitionend event handler property is not supported. To listen to this event, use element.addEventListener('transitionend', function() {});.
The ontransitionrun event handler property is not supported. To listen to this event, use element.addEventListener('transitionrun', function() {});.

safari.notes: The event handler exists but will never be called.

safari_ios.notes: The event handler exists but will never be called.

webview_ios.notes: The event handler exists but will never be called.

ie.notes: The ontransitionstart event handler property is not supported. To listen to this event, use element.addEventListener('transitionstart', function() {});.

safari.notes: The event handler exists but will never be called.

safari_ios.notes: The event handler exists but will never be called.

webview_ios.notes: The event handler exists but will never be called.

notes: Before Firefox 57, transitions do not work when transitioning from a text-shadow with a color specified to a text-shadow without a color specified (see bug 726550).

Before Firefox 57, cancelling a filling animation (for example, with animation-fill-mode: forwards set) can trigger a transition set on the same element, although only once (see bug 1192592 and these test cases for more information).

Before Firefox 57, the background-position property can't be transitioned between two values containing different numbers of <position> values, for example background-position: 10px 10px; and background-position: 20px 20px, 30px 30px; (see bug 1390446).
Before Firefox for Android 57, transitions do not work when transitioning from a text-shadow with a color specified to a text-shadow without a color specified (see bug 726550).

Before Firefox for Android 57, cancelling a filling animation (for example, with animation-fill-mode: forwards set) can trigger a transition set on the same element, although only once (see bug 1192592 and these test cases for more information).

Before Firefox for Android 57, the background-position property can't be transitioned between two values containing different numbers of <position> values, for example background-position: 10px 10px; and background-position: 20px 20px, 30px 30px; (see bug 1390446).
